form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tillis (for himself and Mr. Blumenthal) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Camp Lejeune Justice Act of 2022 to make technical corrections.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ensuring Justice for Camp Lejeune Victims Act of 2025 .

section.header: Technical corrections to the Camp Lejeune Justice Act of 2022
section.text: Section 804 of the Camp Lejeune Justice Act of 2022 (28 U.S.C. 2671 note prec.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of North Carolina; and
by inserting , including a latent or potential harm, after appropriate relief for harm;

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (c) to read as follows:
The party filing an action under this section shall be entitled to appropriate relief upon showing—

subparagraph.text: the existence of 1 or more relationships between the type of contaminant in any water at Camp Lejeune and the type of harm suffered by the individual, including latent or potential harm; and
that the individual was present at Camp Lejeune for a period of not less than 30 days, whether or not consecutive.

paragraph.text: To meet the burden of proof described in paragraph (1), a party shall produce evidence showing that the relationship between exposure to any level of contaminants of a type in any water at Camp Lejeune and the type of harm is—

subparagraph.text: sufficient to conclude that a causal relationship exists; or
sufficient to conclude that a causal relationship is at least as likely as not.

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (d) to read as follows:

The United States District Court for the Eastern District of North Carolina shall have exclusive jurisdiction and venue for coordinated or consolidated pretrial administrative and procedural matters and resolution over any action filed under subsection (b).

A party filing an action under subsection (b) may transfer such action to any district court of the United States situated within the fourth judicial circuit for pretrial and trial of such action, including the adjudication of all evidentiary motions.
Any action against the United States under subsection (b) shall, at the request of either party to such action, be tried by the court with a jury.
The court shall advance an action filed under subsection (b) on the docket, and expedite the disposition of such action to the greatest extent possible.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking latent disease and inserting latent or potential harm; and
by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:

paragraph.header: Health and disability benefits relating to water exposure

subparagraph.text: An award to an individual, or legal representative of an individual, under this section that is made pursuant to a settlement entered before a civil action under subsection (b) is commenced shall not be offset.

An award to an individual, or legal representative of an individual, under this section that is made pursuant to a settlement entered or judgment rendered after a civil action under subsection (b) is commenced shall be offset to the extent permitted by applicable law by the amount of any disability award, payment, or benefit provided to the individual, or legal representative—

subclause.text: any program under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs;
the Medicare program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395 et seq.); or
the Medicaid program under title XIX of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396 et seq.); and

clause.text: in connection with health care or a disability relating to exposure to the water at Camp Lejeune.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
The total amount of attorneys fees under this section shall be in an amount that is not more than—

subparagraph.text: 20 percent of any settlement entered into before a civil action under subsection (b) is commenced; or
25 percent of any judgement rendered or settlement entered into after a civil action under subsection (b) is commenced.

paragraph.text: A division of a fee under paragraph (1) between attorneys who are not in the same firm may be made only if the division is in proportion to the services performed by each attorney.

Nothing in this subsection shall prohibit an individual or the legal representative of an individual and such individual’s or representative’s attorney from agreeing to a fee award that is less than the maximum percentage specified in paragraph (1).

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall take effect as if enacted on August 10, 2022, and shall apply to any claim or action under section 804 of the Camp Lejeune Justice Act of 2022 that is pending on, or filed on or after, the date of enactment of this Act.

Nothing in this Act or an amendment made by this Act shall be construed to modify the applicability or statute of limitations provisions under section 804(j) of the Camp Lejeune Justice Act of 2022 (28 U.S.C. 2671 note prec.).
